Name: Psia kość!
Description:
Bones, food bowls, socks and many other treasures can be discovered by you and your friends. Run through the labyrinth to find out which puppies will get rewards, and then shout out "A dog's life" when you find the puppy with his bone.

Be the first of your friends to guess the puppy or to shout "A dog's life" to get all the cards. Hunt together, but make sure you're the winner.

Name: Kurza stopa!
Description:
The hens were assaulted by the garden worms and they need you and your friends to help them catch all the worms. 
How can you do this? Pay attention to which worm is fighting each chicken, follow the worms on the cards and catch the culprit. When you see the card with the chicken claw, shout out! The player that shouts first wins all the face-up cards.

Name: Motyla noga!
Description:
Do you like butterflies? Well, so does the kitten. More so, the little kitten needs you and your friends to help catch the little butterfly so that they can play together.

Gather your friends and follow the butterfly path while it flies from place to place, and guess where it last landed. You'll win cards if you pay attention to the butterfly's flight path and when the kitten catches the butterfly you shout out.

Name: Fray
Description:
Set in the vibrant fantasy world of Adia, Fray is a fast-paced 1 vs. 1 card game where players fight for control over a battlefield. The game is quick to learn, a blend of strategy and hand management, and it all fits in one little box.

Each copy of Fray comes with:

30 playable cards—featuring the Dwarvish, Duanine, and Bjorn suits.
8 instructional cards—a set for each player.
1 placement card—to establish the 3x3 grid battlefield before the game begins.

When playing, unit placement is one of the most important aspects in a game of Fray. Consider not just which unit card you'll play, but also where on the battlefield you’ll place it! You have a limited number of units and if you’re not careful, your opponent may be able to turn your units against you. Luckily, you can do the same to them!

Rounds take on average just 5-10 minutes once you've learned the rules, and the game is easy to both set up and pack away.

—description from the publisher

Name: ジェム　スクランブル (Gem Scramble)
Description:
In ã‚¸ã‚§ãƒ ã€€ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒ©ãƒ³ãƒ–ãƒ« ("Gem Scramble"), a hex-grid board is seeded randomly with square glass tiles in 9 colors.  The center hex is left empty, and each player starts with their token there.  On their turn, a player moves their token in a straight line as far as they'd like, though they may not move onto or past another token.  If there is a glass tile on the destination space, they collect it.

The game ends after a player has collected a certain number of tiles, which varies depending upon the player count.  Points are awarded based upon collecting many tiles of one color, many tiles regardless of color, and for the gold tiles, certain extra scoring is available.  The player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: USB Cable & Connector
Description: USB Cable & Connector ç¥žçµŒè¡°å¼± (USB Cable & Connector Shinkei suijaku) is a card game where the cards feature different types of USB connections. The players aim to create correct connections between the cards, following the recognized USB standards.

Name: Movie Plotz: Cult Films
Description:
Movie Plotz: Cult Films is the 3rd in the line of standalone Movie Plotz games that allows your group to create hilarious fake movie storylines, then pitch them out loud for maximum laughs. Movie Plotz was designed as a very effective team building event that has evolved into a party game where everyone contributes to the fun.

Players begin with a simple plot (a simple sentence) then draw cards to modify the movie concept. With each draw, players get to redo the pitch and make it even more exciting. In the end, the final plot will be a guaranteed hit!

The game lasts for approximately 20 minutes, until all cards have been played. If you are playing the Last Man Screenwriting variant, the last player standing wins.

This one features 12 cards all based on famous cult films like Pulp Fiction ("Rearrange the order of the scenes."), Office Space ("Add a main character's coworker to the story."), or even The Room ("Make the movie worse.").

—description from the publisher


Each card was also delivered monthly in the 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ packages.

Name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): KS Set
Description:
This is a kickstarter set of items shipped with the D-Day Dice Second Edition Pledges.

Includes:

     Legendary Resource Card (Camo)
     Tricolour Resource Card
     Additional set of RGB dice (6 Dice, 2 of each color)
     War Story Card * Vive La Resistance!
     Red MGF Die
     Gray MGF Die
     Tricolour Unit Die
     Camo Unit Die
     Award Card * Cross of Victory


Specialist Pack

     Ranking Specialist: War Correspondent
     Regular Specialist US: Rookie Officer
     Regular Specialist UK: Rookie Officer
     Regular Specialist Canada: Rookie Officer
     Regular Specialist France: Rookie Officer


Awards Pack 

     Order of Leopold
     Croix Du Combattant Volontaire
     KS Campaign Medal


Legendary Unit: Forces Francaises De L'Interieur

     Legendary Unit Card
     Legendary Item: Codebook
     Legendary Item: Bottle of Wine
     Legendary Item: Clandestine Radio
     Legendary Specialist: Maquisard
     Legendary Specialist: Resistant
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Rampant Swords: Fantasy Skirmish Combat
Description:
Rampant Swords is a scale and model agnostic fantasy model vs. model skirmish game.  
It is designed to be played in about an hour with fully customizable forces from your favorite Fantasy universe.  
The rules can accommodate infantry, cavalry, and monsters.  Players choose generic units and customize them using a Fantasy traits list.  
Most weapons and equipment is abstracted into simple to use Fantasy Traits for the units.

The mechanics are straight forward, streamlined, and easy to learn.  
Rampant Swords uses a d6 dice pool vs. a target number to resolve most actions and mechanics.  
Failure to activate moves play between players.  
The game moves quickly and rapidly.  
If you are familiar with Rampant Sun, Lion Rampant, or Rampant Hordes you will have a core understanding of how these rules function.

Victory in Rampant Swords focuses on completing mission objectives.  These are randomly generated prior to the game and come complete with twists and turns to make every gaming experience unique.  In addition, the rules have campaign rules for linking game results together into a larger campaign.

Rampant Swords is ideal for experienced gamers and new players getting their feet wet.  Speed and ease of play were the priorities in the design process without sacrificing decision making.  
In Rampant Swords models do not always perform exactly as intended so the "Friction of War" will force players to react accordingly.

Enjoy your Fantasy adventures with Rampant Swords!

—description from the publisher

Name: Five Klicks From the Zone: Chapter 1 – Post collapse skirmish campaigns
Description:
After the world fell and the skies burned
We were left to fight on

Welcome to the world of Five Klicks - Skirmish campaign games for solo and cooperative players, using the tried and tested mechanics of Five Parsecs From Home and Five Leagues From the Borderlands.

In Five Klicks From the Zone you will take a squad into the wasteland, fighting to protect your home from the raiders, mutants and worse that seek to destroy it.


     Well tested combat mechanics that have been enhanced to include pinning and more detailed morale effects, fitting the more military atmosphere of this campaign.
     Experience and Loot system for campaign progression. Watch new recruits become battle hardened veterans..or die somewhere in the burnt wasteland.
     Random event tables to build up the narrative.
     Simple, straight-forward rules that make it easy to set up and play a game on your own.
     Terrain generation table.
     Players select their own campaign victory conditions from a list and earn a bonus for completion.
     Playable with most ranges of modern and science fiction miniatures you may already own. 


This is Chapter 1, offering a complete and replayable campaign game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Austerlitz 05
Description:
Austerlitz 05 is a solitaire or two players simulation of one of the most famous and iconic battles of the Napoleonic period: Austerlitz, which was fought during the War of the Third Coalition in Moravia on December 2nd 1805.

It is remembered as the Battle of the Three Emperors, because of the presence of Napoleon 1°, French Emperor, Francis 2° of Austria and Alexander 2° Russian Czar.

A lot of wargames have already depicted this battle, this simulation wants to give an utter contribution to the hobby, thanks to the dynamic Combat system and the opportunity to play the battle in about 15 minutes!

A colorful map, 48 counters (or wooden counters), 28 Event Cards, the rules...

will you win the day?

—description from the publisher

Name: Navarchus: Naval Warfare during the Punic Wars
Description:
Navarchus is a miniature tabletop naval warfare game for scale 1:300

In the third century BC Rome was growing in power, but Carthage stood in the way.

The Carthaginians had controlled the Western Mediterranean for more than a century using a fleet of hundreds of war galleys. By coincidence the Romans captured one of these vessels. And because all parts of the vessel were painstakingly numbered Rome could now build its own fleet. Within 6 months Rome possessed a fleet of 120 war galleys.

The war for the Mediterranean could commence...

—description from the publisher

Name: L'Assassino: Feud & Vendetta in the Italian Renaissance
Description:
In the renaissance families like the Medici stood up to seize power. 
People like Machiavelli wrote books about Utilitarianism and real-politik. 
Condottieri roamed the Italian landscape searching for fame and fortune. 
It was a time full of feud and vendettas. 
Even Shakespeare wrote a piece about love and hate between two families in Verona, the Capulets and the Montagues (better known as Romeo and Juliet). What better time and place to set up a skirmish game?

L'Assassino contains the rules for a miniature tabletop skirmish game for 28mm scale miniatures set during renaissance. 
It focuses on urban strive.

This game can be played with one player. But you may want to add a little competition when played with more than one player.

—description from the publisher

Name: Outlands: An Action Driven Miniature Skirmish Game
Description:
OUTLANDS is a Sci-Fi Spaghetti Western set on the mysterious and deadly planet of Paradise.

The gameplay revolves around an Action/Reaction System that keeps both players in the game. 
The unrestricted rule system allows YOU to 'Level Up' your characters, whilst training new and exciting skills. 
You can make your characters the way YOU want.

Ideally suited for campaign play between a group of friends, the rules allow for one off stand alone games.

All you need to play is this rulebook, 5 models per player (ANY miniatures you already own), a tape measure and a handful of 6 sided dice.

Get ready to take your 1st exciting steps into the OUTLANDS.

The 114 page rulebook include:

     A complete and comprehensive rule system explaining every aspect of OUTLANDS The Game,
     50 Abilities and Special Skills,
     40+ Items of Equipment.
      A revolutionary weapon modification system so that no two weapons are the same.
     Complete rules for creating a 'Spice Hunter' warband.


—description from the publisher

Name: El Zorro y el Condor
Description:
The "Zorro" (fox) and the Condor is a game that narrates/recreates the story of 4 chachawarmi who must travel from the coast to their village in the mountains. In their journey they must choose between the way of the Condor (which represents knowledge) and the way of the Zorror (which represents fortune). The winner is the chawarmi who has the largest flock of llamas after the trip.

This is an bilingual educational game (Spanish/Aymara) based on Aymara legends/myths of the altiplano (north of Chile, Peru and Bolivia).

—user summary

Name: Captain's Log #12
Description:
Preview: Early Years

Scenarios:  The Klingon battlecruiser Destruction makes its Finishing Run. The Airsisians use Klingon weapons to Win a Few against the Federation. The Kzinti carrier Typhoon engages an Andromedan Intruder. Hydran raiders meet Unexpected Resistance. Pilot rescue turns deadly with Escorts En Passant.

Also includes:  A short story featuring a WYN frigate; announcements and convention schedules; Q&A regarding the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition; a preview of Module Y (Early Years); tactics discussions; Federation & Empire content; and more.

—description from the back of the book

Name: Funkoverse Strategy Game: Kool-Aid Man 100
Description:
"OH YEAH!" Combine Kool-Aid Man with your Funkoverse Strategy Games and splash other characters with fresh new abilities.

In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in exciting game scenarios.

Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens. Funkoverse uses an innovative "cooldown" system—the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again—so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for the different game scenarios.

Funkoverse Strategy Game Expansion: Kool-Aid Man #KA100 is an expansion for any standalone title in the Funkoverse line-up that features:

     A unique playable character, Kool-Aid Man! 
     New abilities that allow Kool-Aid Man to bust through walls!
     Sparkly Points to add an effervescence to your victory
     The ability to combine this expansion with other Funkoverse titles to create the ultimate team
     Since Kool-Aid Man can bust through walls, altering the map through the use of his Rubble Tokens, the game changes for all characters in play!
     Kool-Aid Man’s Splash Zone ability is a powerful area of effect attack that can do a Challenge 3 to all adjacent rivals.
     Kool-Aid Man’s Oh Yeah! ability allows him to move through a wall and do a challenge with a single action. Use this to surprise rivals that thought they were safe behind a wall.

Name: Return to Camelot
Description:
The Lords have returned to Camelot, to reclaim their place at the Round Table! Return to Camelot is a strategic boardgame for 2 players, inspired by the game Chivalry (1887) by George S. Parker. Players take the role of medieval lords, commanding their armies of knights, soldiers, and wizards. Try to conquer your opponent’s castles or capture their lord!

COMPONENTS


     board (8×8)
     20 black pieces with white engraving: 2× lord, 2× wizard, 4× knight, 12× soldier
     carrying case


RULES OVERVIEW (please refer to rulebook)

Players take turns performing actions. On your turn, perform one of the following four actions with one of your pieces (however, if any of your pieces can Capture, the Capture action has priority):


     Capture (by jumping over)
     Deploy (a previously captured piece)
     Move (to adjacent square)
     Jump


TYPES OF PIECES

Soldier: This basic piece can Move, Jump, and Capture.

Knight: You can reveal it to perform an action called “Knight's Charge”.

Wizard: When it Moves, once per game, you can permanently reveal it to cast one of the following two magic spells:

      Divination      
      Teleportation


Lord: This piece can Move, Jump, Capture, and Knight’s Charge.

END OF THE GAME

You win the game if any of the following occur:

      You capture your opponent's lord.
      You occupy one of your opponent’s castles with your lord.
      You occupy both enemy castles with any two of your pieces.


—description from the publisher

Name: Tsukuyumi: Full Moon Down – Sentinels Expansion
Description:
It is their holy quest to save earth from the Oni. They are mystic warriors, arising from the Jade Kingdom, a realm in which all surviving otherworldly creatures found shelter, after humans began killing and hunting them. The Sentinels still protect the earth whenever Oni walk it. So they return through their jade portals. Possessed with the magic of ancient times, like the Kami had, they can hide in plain sight. Their jade armor hides them, when a mortal is looking at them.

As Oni appeared in several times during earth's history, the Sentinels adapted to these times. Although they are ancient warriors, some use modern technology while others stay traditional. But in the end, they are here to save the earth - but not the humans anymore. They walk between both worlds, the protectors of two realms.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marie-Louise
Description:
Marie-Louise is an evolution of the Billy Yank system for the Napoleonic period.

Also provides army list for the Mexican-American War of 1846/8.

Published in French

—description from the publisher

Name: Paupers' Ladder: The Moonlighters
Description:
The Moonlighters is a print-and-play expansion for Paupers’ Ladder. It adds the following elements to the game, any or all of which can be used.

36 Talent cards:
Talent cards give your Pauper and/or Bird special skills, bonuses and tasks. Each player chooses 1 Talent at the start of the game, and gains another each time they learn a Virtue.

10 Special Quest cards:
Special Quests are Quests that can only be completed by the player they belong to. They involve your Pauper carrying out a series of tasks, and are placed in your Journal once they are completed. They count towards learning the Virtue of fellowship as normal.

3 Game Variant cards: Any or all of these can be added to make small variations to the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Au Son du Clairon
Description:
Au Son du Clairon is an evolution of the Billy Yank rule system to the Franco-Prussian War.

It also includes an expansion for the Russo-Turkish War of 1877-1878.

Published in French

—description from the publisher

Name: Twilight of the Soldier Kings: Wargame Rules for the Battles in the Age of Frederick the Great 1730-1780
Description:
The Twilight of the Soldier Kings rules is a set designed to fight large historical battles on a reasonable sized table and with a reasonable number of figures in the era of Fredereick the Great (1730 to 1770). The player is the army commander seeking to marshal the full forces that their historical counterpart had to achieve victory and not some colonel or brigadier controlling a few battalions or squadrons in the fight for some sector of a battlefield. The concentration is on the 'big picture' rather on relatively unimportant details. The rules reward historic tactics and practices while making typical 'gamer' tactics obsolete. So, players will want their forces to be in at least two lines with a reserve and not strung out in a line as is commonly done in other rules.

The system is intuitive and easy to pick up. The units are around 2,500 infantry, around 1,200 cavalry and 12 to 20 guns and so the units are often a brigade of around 4 infantry battalions or 8 to 12 cavalry squadrons. The scale is flexible with all distances, ranges, movements based on half of the frontage of the units you use. For example, if your units have a frontage of perhaps 100mm (4 inches) the standard measurement unit in the game will be 50mm (2 inches). There is no figure removal so you can base you units as you wish, with any number or size of figures on a base, etc. As long as the units are the same frontage it does not matter and indeed neither does it if the armies involved are based differently.

While any unit size can be used if the frontage of a unit is in the region of 120mm then most battles can be fought on a table 1.8m by 1.2m (6 feet by 4 feet) or similar. Most standard battles should be playable in a typical afternoon or evening playing session. It is possible to play 'Manoeuvre' battles in which the attacker has extra options to attack but will usually require a larger table. In a standard battle the armies are on table in their half of the table and generally facing up to each other. While in a manoeuvre battle the defending army is in active and placed in the centre of the table with a wide area empty of troops around them. The attacking army can then attempt to march around the defending army to attack from one or more different directions. Alternatively the attacking army can arrive on table in sections from all edges of the table in a converging attack. Of course these manoeuvres might not work or can be delayed or the inactive defenders can activate and react to the situation.

The rules include scenarios for the battles of Mollwitz (1741), Kolin (1757), Krefeld (1758) and a generic Manoeuvre battle based on the battles of Hochkirch and Zorndorf (both 1758).

—description from the publisher
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession

Name: Stat Protocol
Description:
Stat Protocol was designed by medical professionals who still have a sense of humor.  In Stat Protocol, each player is a doctor at a hospital which has been inundated with sick patients!  Players randomly select patients from a deck of cards who each have descriptions of their care, special instructions and length of stay.  Patients are drawn randomly and play is impacted by the event cards and choices that the players (doctors) make with "drug" tokens as well as the number rolled on the dice.  Players may choose to discharge patients or remove them from ICU depending on their game strategy. Don't worry -- you don't need a medical degree to play this game!

—description from the designer

Name: Blitzkrieg Commander: Fast-Play Tabletop Wargame Rules for Combined-Arms Operations, 1936-45
Description:
Blitzkrieg Commander II is an exciting wargame that allows you to re-create battles of the Second World War and Spanish Civil War using miniatures on a tabletop. Command anything from a company right up to a division and get a result in 2-3 hours without becoming bogged-down in detail. Suitable for any scale miniatures from 2mm right up to 28mm (including 6mm, 1/285, 10mm, 12mm, N Scale, 15mm and 20mm) and no re-basing required.

The rules are available as a 140-page A4-sized book (either a perfect bound hard-copy full-colour book, a print-on-demand monochrome book or a full-colour electronic PDF document) with over 45 pictures that illustrate how to play the game. These feature real miniatures as you see them on the gaming table not diagrams that belong in a physics textbook! You also get a double-sided A4-sized quick reference sheet.

Name: Twilight of the Soldier Kings: European Battles in the Age of Frederic the Great 1730-1780 – Scenario Book 1
Description: Includes detailed information on 12 battles, 5 from The War of the Austrian Succession (1740-1748) and 7 from The Seven years War (1756-1763).

Name: Flyin' Goblin: Hop Goblins Promo
Description:
A new piece, bounding from room to room, hopping ever closer to victory! This promo piece for Flyin’ Goblin changes a few rules in the base game, as described below.

Game set up:
During step 5 of set up, replace the Soldier Goblin in the  space "4" with the Hop Goblin. Leave the replaced Soldier Goblin in the box. It won’t be used for this game

Gameplay:
2. Looting:
Soldier retrieval step: before retrieving your Hop Goblin from a Room in the Castle, you can move it to an adjacent Room before applying any other effects. You can’t move it diagonally or into the Tower.Then retrieve your pieces in whatever order you choose.
4. Recruitment:
When you recruit a Soldier Goblin, you still have to start with the one with the lowest cost among those available. This means that your Hop Goblin can only be bought second, not first.

Name: Outlands: Legends – How To Be A Badass
Description:
OUTLANDS LEGENDS: How To Be A Badass!!! is a mini-supplement for OUTLANDS.

Outlands Legends is an achievement bolt-on system that allows your warbands earned extra credits and bonuses to Heroic and Special Actions.

Be A Legend. Be A BADASS!!!!!

—description from the publisher

Name: Outlands: Mini Expansion 1 – The Noob
Description:
The Noob is the 1st Mini-Expansion For OUTLANDS.

This rulebook will allow you to recruit The Noob for your warband.

Explain the training process and 'On The Job Training' experience.

Most importantly it will allow you to deploy a maximum of 6 models instead of the normal 5.

—description from the publisher

Name: With Pike and Musket: Sixteenth- and Seventeenth- Century Battles for the Wargamer
Description:
With Pike and Musket: Sixteenth- and Seventeenth- Century Battles for the Wargamer is a book that contains Wesencraft's 16th and 17th Century Wargaming rules plus Twenty-eight scenarios from the English Civil War.

The English Civil War is not a satisfactory name as it started in Scotland and spread to Ireland before reaching England. This classic book arms the reader with a working knowledge of the weapons and their uses, then presents suggested rules of play which will enable the table-top general to manoeuvre and fight in the manner of Charles I, Rupert, Essex, Cromwell, and the rest.

No less than twenty-seven battles of the period are described, including the numbers engaged, types of troops, battle maps and objectives. More than three hundred years after the dust of battle has settled, once again the New Model Army faces Newcastle's Whitecoats across a low  valley. The outcome will depend upon the ability of the reader. Run out the guns and let the battle commence!

—description from the publisher

Introduction rules to the ECW with miniatures.

IGOUGO type rules
Individually based figures
27 scenarios (21 for ECW)

Name: Wayfarer Tactics
Description:
Wayfarer Tactics is dynamic, modular miniature wargaming system

With these rules, you use models from your collection to enact skirmished, large-scale battles, or party-centered dungeon crawls. Based loosely on our Wayfarer multiverse setting, you can stage your battles in worlds of magic-rich high fantasy, far flung intergalactic sci-fi, or anything in between.


     Any genre! Fantasy, Modern, Steampunk, whatever!
     Any model! Whatever kind of miniatures you collect, you can use them!
     Tell your story! The engine let's you customize your own characters and forces!


—description from back of the book

Name: A Perfect Sheet of Flame: American Civil War Miniature Wargame Rules
Description:
American Civil War miniature wargame rules.

This is the most recent version of a series of miniature wargame rules that have been developed over a long period of time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Astra Imperia: Space Combat Simluations
Description:
Astra Imperia is a tabletop wargame.

Expand and explore space around you.

Exploit worlds and exterminate your enemies.

Rules include tactical combat, including ship building and strategic empire building

—description from the publisher

Name: Lord and Lands
Description:
A mass battles wargames rule-set for any scale of miniatures, any genre, any manufacturer.  Historical, fantasy or both.

A unique command and control system which allows the player to order and move their forces, but beware the fortunes of war may not always be in your favour as each turn you play chance will influence the capacity you have for change.

A miniatures game for 2 players.

Name: Spinglas / Meine Party
Description:
Didactic game produced by an university, to help understand the nature of spin glasses or other complex optimization problems, like organizing a party.
The main target is to choose the favorite orientations of the spins/party guest and their interactions such that each player maximizes the number of spins/guests exhibiting the orientation of the player, respectively.

Via some additional action cards you can increase the number of strategic operations.

Name: Lost Ship
Description:
Your civilization’s great migration was just beginning when something went wrong. From your place on the bridge, you watched the lead colony ship explode, starting a chain reaction of fire and death that wiped out half the fleet in an instant...

Now, half a galaxy away, you fly under unfamiliar skies. You have no way back to the fleet, no way of knowing if there is even a fleet to return to. You press on alone, lost, in search of a planet to call your own. You will find it or die.

A game of Lost Ship consists of encounters between your ship and alien threats as you leap from system to system in search of a habitable planet. Between battles, you will search for materials, make repairs, care for your pilots, and search for a planet your people can inhabit.

If you find home, you win. If your ship runs out of fuel or is destroyed, you lose, and your civilization dies with you.

—description from the designer

Name: Gruff: Whispers of Madness
Description:
Once upon a time the 3 Billy-Goats Gruff were stopped by a horrible troll while trying to cross a bridge. The goats destroyed that Troll, and ever since that time shepherds have weaponized their herds to become mutated monster goats called Gruffs! Gruff is a tactical combat card game where players duel to the death with custom teams of Mutated Monster Goats! Gruff features unique positional and timing mechanics that create a constant state of attack and counter-play.

Gruff: Whispers of Madness is a stand-alone game that is fully compatible with the Gruff rules system and other Gruff games. Whispers of Madness provides the same visceral competitive experience as Gruff, but adds a new mechanic to the game, Sanity and Madness!

A Brutally Competitive Game- Whispers of Madness' combat mechanics create a constant state of counter-play. When an enemy attacks, you have your entire turn to dodge out of the way, mount your defenses, and launch a counterattack before the attack connects!

A Challenging Single Player Game- In Whispers of Madness you will be able to battle solo against the trolls that we unlock as stretch-goals in the campaign. Each troll is a distinct challenge ranging from fairly simple to extremely challenging!

An Awesome Co-Op Game- Players can collaborate with each other to take down the trolls that we unlock during the campaign!  Play cards to support your teammate on their turn so that you both can taste the sweetness of victory together!

A Fantastic Multiplayer Game- Whispers of Madness can support a four-player tournament out of a single box! It also allows for three- and four-player free-for-all matches and a two-vs.-two mode!

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Game Face
Description:
In Game Face, the active player each round dons the plastic mask, draws one of the game cards to see what they want to draw that others might guess, then proceeds to draw on the mask that they're wearing — drawing backwards right in front of their own eyes — while everyone else tries to guess the right answer.

You can also have another player don the mask and draw on their face!

Name: Rebels and Yankees: Quick Play Rules for Wargaming the American Civil War
Description:
Rebels and Yankees have been designed to introduce new players into wargaming in American Civil War and provide more experienced gamers a simple more relaxed way of enjoying the period without the complexities and depth of match play.
 These rules are not written to provide a purist simulation of the period, but a game with a flavor for the period.

Rebel and Yankees uses 1 base width (BW) to equal 40 yds with 80 men deployed in two ranks. Several bases would make up a regiment unit depending on the regiments size. Base Widths (BW) are used also in the game for movement and range distances. Where players wish to use figures instead of the bases. If that is the case, then for distances use an inch instead of a base width. Calculate dice on number of figures in the front rank instead of the number of bases. For 15mm a base would be around 40mm and in 25/28mm a base width would be around 60mm.

To play the games all you need are six-sided dice (D6), your own models based in a common way between the two forces, terrain to represent the landscape of your battlefield and a ruler.

Name: Welcome to New Las Vegas: Vegas Goodies Cards
Description:
This is a small set of 6 promo cards for the game Welcome to New Las Vegas.

Each casino card has a star instead of the number and is aimed to be played like a joker: the player can enter the number he wants in a casino of his choice. The back of the cards has the usual symbols (one card of each type: Inauguration, Construction, Limo, Show, and 2 Improvements).

The casino side of these cards has a gloss finish.

Name: Ferrum et Gloria: Regole per Scontri tra Gladiatori – Basate sul motore di Song of Blades
Description:
Ferrum et Gloria is fast play rule for gladiator combat.
Players can play a single gladiator or a gladiators school.
It includes a mini-campaign and rules cover calling to the crowd, effects of fatigue, wounds, many types of attacks...

Ferrum et Gloria è un veloce regolamento per scontri tra gladiatori. Ogni figura rappresenta un combattente con uno specifico repertorio di mosse a seconda del suo addestramento e armamento. Le regole sono basate sulle più recenti ricerche storiche.

Ogni giocatore controlla un singolo gladiatore o un’intera scuola di gladiatori. Un sistema di dadi colorati registra le ferite di ogni combattente.

Ferrum et Gloria contiene regole per:
12 classi gladiatorie;
Scontro tra scuole (mini-campagna);
Tecniche di scherma, opposizione e lotta;
Appello alla folla;
Vari tipi di risultati di combattimento, che consentono di sbilanciare, ferire, disarmare, allontanare o intrappolare in reti;
Simulazione della stanchezza e dell'effetto delle ferite;
Diverse velocità di movimento basate su armamento e stanchezza;
Duelli o combattimenti tra più avversari.
Families: Series: Song of Blades and Heroes

Name: Bee First
Description:
In Bee First, be the first person to move all your bees from the garden into the hive to win, avoiding predatory wasps and bad weather.

Bee First is a dice game with math option for children and families.

Two versions are available for different ages.
Ages 3-6 use single die rolls to move bees.
Ages 5+ use two dice where math equations control movement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Chef de Char: 1944-1945
Description:
Chef de Char is a beer and pretzel ruleset to simulate tank combats.
Each player represents a tank leader and gives orders to his crew, those are then executed.
—user summary

Chef de Char est une règle 'apéritif' rapide et létale. L'idée n'est pas de faire une règle pointue de simulation mais une règle qui peut, tout à la fois servir à faire découvrir les jeux de stratégie et permettre de passer un bon moment de jeu. Ce n'est pas une règle historique à proprement parlé, l'histoire est présente car la règle intègre les caractéristiques des chars de l'époque.

Cette règle est très simple à prendre ne main et en 2 à trois tours la mécanique est acquise. 
Il y a 3 formats de jeux. Patrouille avec 5 chars par camp, Peloton avec 7 et compagnie avec 12 chars. En fonction du format chaque joueur dispose d'un nombre de point de commandement qu'il dépense pour réaliser un maximum de 3 actions. 
Le joueur est le chef du char actif. Il faut imaginer que le chef de char donne ces ordres à son équipage (le joueur énonce à haute voix ce qu'il va faire), les ordres sont reçus par l'équipage (le joueur dépense ses points de commandement), l'équipage exécute les ordres (le joueur réalise les actions énoncées). 
L'activation d'un char est faite par tirage au sort si bien que les deux joueurs doivent être attentif à ce qui se passe.La stratégie tient alors autant dans le placement sur le terrain, que dans la gestion des points de commandement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Paranormal Research
Description:
A paranormal investigation awaits you, you have to collect evidence in one of the most haunted houses in the world, but watch out for the ghosts that are lurking, study your moves well, you won't be able to get out alive! Keep an eye on the EMF detector if the level increases becomes more and more difficult!
Will you face the investigation alone or will you ask your teammates for help to play as a team?
Can you finish the investigation or will you be overwhelmed by the ghosts?
Two game modes: normal or extreme.
Cooperative game for 1 to 5 players.

—description from the designer

Name: Warzoom
Description:
Warzoom is a skirmish ruleset for small battles in major conflicts of the first half of the 20th century. 
Scale independent where 1 mini represents 1 man, it offers 3 modes of play:

     fast game
     mini-campaign
     grand-campaign


Warzoom est une règle de jeux d’escarmouche avec figurines destinée à vous faire revivre de grands conflits sur de petites batailles. Adaptés à tous types d’échelles et dotés d’un système innovant d’évolution du terrain de jeu, aucune partie ne ressemblera à la précédente.

Dans ce livre, vous trouverez toutes les règles nécessaires pour rejouer des conflits de la première moitié du 20ème siècle, mais également :

     Des règles de budget pour créer votre propre groupe de combat
     Un système d’expérience simple pour vos soldats
     Des scénarios indépendants ou pour débuter une mini campagne
     Des règles d'actions héroïques pour pimenter les parties !

Name: Avalon La Búsqueda del Grial
Description:
Avalon The Grail Quest is a semi-operational board game for 3 to 6 players, with mechanics of worker placement (in this case Knights), obtaining points, and building a resource pool.

Brief review of the game. Each player with their Knights must perform actions with them depending on the resources obtained in their resource pool (in this case called energies that can be of 4 types: Combat, Diplomacy, Exploration and Teson) that are going to determine what types of actions you can Perform each turn. The actions available are numerous: battle enemies, explore places, enliven diplomatic relations, rescue ladies, participate in tournaments, all this to be the player with the most Honor (PV) that he obtains at the end of the game. But all this in addition cooperating with the opponents so that the enemies of the kingdom do not destroy it using a Damage Table that if it reaches the maximum all players will lose, thus adding a little cooperation to the competition.
Unfold your board and create your deck. Your goal is to defeat the Pantheon of your opponent to survive!

Avalon is a board game that aims to represent the comings and goings of the Knights of the Round Board in their quest for the Holy Grail.

—description from the designer

Avalon. La Búsqueda del Grial, es un juego de mesa semicooperativo para 2 a 5 jugadores, con mecánicas de colocación de trabajadores (en este caso Caballeros), obtención de puntos, y construcción de una bolsa de recursos.

Breve reseña del juego. Cada jugador con sus Caballeros debe realizar acciones con ellos dependiendo de los recursos obtenidos en su bolsa de recursos (en este caso llamados energías que pueden ser de 4 tipos: Combate, Diplomacia, Exploración y Tesón) que van vana determinar que tipos de acciones puedes realizar cada turno. Las acciones disponibles son numerosas: batallar enemigos, explorar lugares, avivar las relaciones diplomáticas, rescatar a damas, participar en torneos, todo ello para ser el jugador que más Honor (PV) que consiga al final de la partida. Pero todo esto además cooperando con los oponentes para que los enemigos del reino no lo destruyan usando para ello una Tabla de Daños que si llega al máximo todos los jugadores perderán, añadiendo así a la competición un poco de cooperación.
Despliega tu tablero y crea tu mazo. !!Tu objetivo es derrotar el Panteón de tu oponente para sobrevivir!!

Avalon es un juego de tablero que pretende representar las idas y venidas de los Caballeros de la Tablera Redonda en su búsqueda del Santo Grial.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
Families: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

Name: A Hot Dry Season: Operation Attleboro in War Zone C
Description:
A Hot Dry Season: Operation Attleboro in War Zone C (AHDS) is an operational-level game dealing with the National Liberation Front (NLF) Dry Season Offensive in the III Corps Tactical Zone (III CTZ) in November 1966 and the subsequent counterattack by forces under the command of Military Assistance Command, Vietnam (MACV).  From the designer’s website:

"To Military Assistance Command-Vietnam (MACV), Operation Attleboro was a meeting engagement in War Zone C that grew into the largest operation involving US Forces conducted in South Vietnam at that time.  To the Central Office for South Vietnam (COSVN), Operation Attleboro was unexpected early contact by a force attempting to conduct an offensive that snowballed into a desperate defense and fighting withdrawal to protect precious logistic and command capabilities essential to their future operations in III Corps Tactical Zone (III CTZ).

MACV grossly underestimated the National Liberation Front’s (NLF) capability to supply their own forces, tactically maneuver them, and evade detection in order to threaten US/Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN) infrastructure and units when operating in close proximity to Peoples’ Liberation Forces of South Vietnam (PLAF – what are popularly known as “Viet Cong Main Force”) base areas in Cambodia.  COSVN grossly underestimated the US’s capability to rapidly reinforce an area of operations using strategic mobility and rapidly employ such reinforcements almost immediately in the field.

MACV underestimated the proclivity of COSVN to use PLAF forces confront and destroy threats to its logistics and supply system.  COSVN erroneously expected US Forces to respond to tactical and operational dilemmas like the ARVN.  To wit, responding to “Ambush and Bait” with dispersed pursuits of the ambushers on multiple axis, thus leaving some pursuing units vulnerable to destruction via “One Slow, Four Quick”.  Both sides were unaware of flaws and gaps in their respective intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) networks, and the murky picture of active operations that would result from a clash of this magnitude, in the trying terrain of War Zone C.  Neither side gained any lasting advantage from Operation Attleboro, though both sides missed opportunities to secure them."

The game’s scale is Company as the primary unit size, day turns and a mile per hex.  AHDS uses a concealed information/movement mechanism for NLF units and a limited information availability mechanism for both sides, and heavily emphasizes Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) capabilities and their impact on revealing concealed/limited information units.  The game uses a movement point system and combat result table mechanisms fires, air defense fire and ground combat.  AHDS has an asymmetric component to its turns, as an Initiative player determines the order of resolution of Fires attacks and missions and then Operations (movement and combat).  Within Operations, interactivity and reactions to phasing player action; reaction moves and hasty attacks may be performed by the non-phasing player as the phasing player’s turn is resolved.  Uncertainty is added to victory and even game end in the campaign by the use of Operational Guidance chits which are selected before set up – neither side may be exactly certain what the other’s priorities are, which impacts victory conditions and player strategy as the game progresses.

AHDS contains 7 scenarios: Introductory, Basic, and Intermediate, ranging from 3 to 10 game turns. The campaign is 25 turns long, but may, through Operational Guidance chit play referred to above, last 30 turns.

AHDS is the first entry in a new series, Campaigns in Vietnam, which features a “Ground-Up Build” system.  While sharing core concepts and “DNA” in resolution of play and movement/combat mechanisms, each title is built from the “Ground-Up” allowing specific tailoring of concepts and rules mechanisms in an attempt to accurately evoke the very different Campaigns fought during the Vietnam War from 1965-1975 and faithfully incorporate the dynamic changes in force structure and composition, weapons and ISR capabilities, specific operational goals and difficulties, and terrain and regional variances unique to Vietnam and the Vietnam War.

Basic Information
Map Scale: 1 mile per Hex
Unit Size: Companies
Time Scale: One day per Turn.
Players: 2
Complexity: Medium-High
Solitaire Suitability: Medium
Play by Email Components: Vassal Module completed, available upon game release.

Game Components and Specifications
Game Map: 22” x 34”    
Game Counters: 840 each .5” Counters (Three Countersheets)
Rulebook: 50 Pages (Color)
Playbook: 50 Pages; contains Scenarios and Campaign, Examples of Play, Designers' Notes, Historical Notes and Tips on Play and Strategy (Color).
Player Aids and Charts: 6 x Double-Sided (Color), 4 x Single Sided (color)
Scenarios and Campaign: Seven Introductory, Basic and Intermediate Scenarios; One Campaign.
Dice: One Ten-Sided Die and Two Six-Sided Dice.

—description from the publisher

262 is a wargame showing the fights of fighter and bomber planes over Europe in 1944-45. Players may perform air operations as pilots of Lutwaffe, British RAF or US Air Force. Air combat, fight against bombers expeditions or their protection are the main tasks of the players. The variety of scenarios guarantees fast and excellent play. 
—description from the publisher

262 to gra strategiczna ukazujÄ…ca walki powietrzne samolotów myÅ›liwskich i bombowych nad EuropÄ… w latach 1944-45. Gracze mogÄ… prowadziÄ‡ dziaÅ‚ania powietrzne wcielajÄ…c siÄ™ w pilotów Luftwaffe, brytyjskiego RAF lub US Air Force. Walki powietrzne, zwalczanie wypraw bombowych lub ich osÅ‚ona to gÅ‚ówne zadania graczy. RóÅ¼norodnoÅ›Ä‡ scenariuszy gwarantuje szybkÄ… i doskonaÅ‚Ä… grÄ™. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: The Infinity Gauntlet
Description:
Thanos is in search of the Infinity Stones. If he collects all six in his Gauntlet, he'll be unstoppable.

The Infinity Gauntlet adds an epic game mode to Marvel United. Embark on a sequence of up to four games in the struggle to first keep the Children of Thanos from gathering all Infinity Stones, then battle against Thanos himself. Over the course of the first three games, try to defeat the Children of Thanos as quickly as possible to prevent too many Infinity Stones from falling into their master's hands, all the while sparing some effort to unlock power-ups that may be decisive in the final confrontation.

Should you make it to the end, you'll take the fight directly to Thanos, who is empowered by the Stones collected in his Infinity Gauntlet. The Heroes will need to unite and make the best use of their power-ups if they are to save the universe!

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel United: Enter the Spider-Verse
Description: Marvel United: Enter the Spider-verse allows you to add multiple new Spiderpeople to your Marvel United game, with Green Goblin being included as a new villain to fight. The Kickstarter version (see different entry in the database) includes Spider-Ham as a bonus character, but this version doesn't.

Name: Marvel United: Return of the Sinister Six
Description: Marvel United: Return of the Sinister Six features villains Doctor Octopus, Electro, Kraven the Hunter, Mysterio, Sandman, and Vulture. Each can be confronted as a normal villain, but this expansion also offers a gameplay experience like no other through its "Sinister Six Mode", in which you get to play against all six of these villains together!

Name: Chinese Nationalist Army: Manchuria and Burma 1937-1945
Description:
Flames of war compatible force list supplement to BattleFront Flames of War game.

A copy of FoW is required to use this book

Covering the Chinese Nationalist Forces fighting the Japanese from 1937-1945.

A companion to the Imperial Japanese Army Handbook Manchuria & SE Asia 1940-1945

—description from the publisher

Name: Oh, Sheep!
Description: Oh, Sheep! is a fast-paced and strategic card game in which players will have to try and get rid of their hand as fast as possible. There are attack, defend and some chaos-mechanics to keep the game engaging and fun for all players.

Name: Math Tac Toe
Description:
Math Tac Toe is a mathematical dice game where two to four players use simple equations using only the die roll numbers 1 through 6 to control territory and gain points.

This lasercut wooden game comes with a 6x6 game board with four integrated scoring tracks, 36 two-sided tiles and a pair of dice. The tiles have one of 19 numbers on one side and an arrow on the flip side.

On each turn, a player will…

     Roll both dice
     Formulate two to four math equations using both numbers
     Flip any tile that matches that matches the answer to one of the mathematical equations based on the two numbers rolled.
     Align the arrow to point to the player
     Score one point if three or more arrows face the player.


Play until someone hits 15 points,

Examples of math equations using die faces:
 1+6=7   6x5=30  7-3=4  8÷2=4

The only possible mathematical answers for a pair of dice are: 1-12, 15, 16, 18, 20, 24, 30 and 36.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monoch
Description: Monoch is an abstract strategy game in which black and white blocks are combined. The goal is to be the first player to connect both ends of the blocks (Obi) in your color while meeting the building requirements.

Name: Vegas Slot Machine 1973: Spin Again
Description: 4 cards expansion. A player may take a extra turn by playing a Spin Again card.

Name: Chef de Char: Opération Desert Sabre Daguet
Description:
Chef de Char Guerre du Golfe is a supplement for Chef de Char on the 2nd Gulf War.

Additions:

     rules (for helicopters, missiles, etc...)
     vehicles (Iraqi- US - British - French)
     helicopters
     scenarios


—description from publisher, published in French

Name: Onslaught to Orsha 2: Operation Bagration
Description:
Operation Bagration - The Death of Army Group Center June-July 1944.

From the back of the game:
The Minsk-Moscow Highway, Belorussia, 23 June 1944:
The 16th Guards Rifle Division was one of three heavily reinforced infantry divisions that were to create holes in the German lines and allow tank forces of the 2nd Guards Tank Corps of the 5th Tank Army to make rapid and deep penetrations along the Moscow-Minsk Highway. The zone of the 16th was south of the highway, and along the Smolensk-Minsk Railroad. They were reinforced with the following units: 148th Tank Regiment (PT mineroller tanks), 63rd Guards Heavy Tank Regiment (KVs), 517th Tank Regiment (FT tanks), elements of several Self-Propelled Artillery Regiments, 2nd Guards Assault Engineer-Sapper Brigade, as well as numerous towed artillery units. The Soviet forces trained as a combined arms team prior to the attack, and were well prepared. In most sectors of Army Group Center, the Germans had relatively thin lines, and most armor and heavy artillery was stripped to defend expected areas of attack. The area of the highway had seen much heavy fighting in the winter of 1943-44, and the Germans expected an attack to come in this direction. When German intelligence detected the buildup of artillery and armored forces, as well as the movement of ammunition, their reaction was to ensure forces in this area retained significant combat strength. The 78th Sturm Division, already the most powerful ‘infantry‘ division in Army Group Center, maintained its structure which included the 189th Assault Gun Battalion (StuG), a Heavy Tank Destroyer Battalion (PzJgIII/IVs), 5th Nebelwerfer Battalion (120mm Mortars), and Army Antiaircraft Battalion 293 (mix of 88s/20s). These forces defended from probably the most dense network of mines, trenches, and bunkers in Army Group Center, including special rotating bunkers housing machine-guns.

Onslaught to Orsha Contents:

     32 scenarios
     1 Campaign Game
     2 SASL (Solitaire ASL) scenarios
     370 full color 1/2" counters
     384 full color 5/8" counters
     3 HASL Mapsheets (2-22"x27", 1-28"x27") which combine to form a historical map of the Orsha Plain.
     2 16"x22" doublewide mapboards DW-8, DW-9
     Rules describing the aircraft, vehicles, guns, map terrain, and campaign game rules.
     Player aids 


This expansion does not come in a box, the coversheets, maps, countersheets, and rules are packaged together in shrinkwrap.

Ownership of the following is required to play all of the included scenarios:

     BPF: Crucible of Steel, Into the Rubble 2, Poland in Flames
     MMP: Beyond Valor, Solitaire ASL
     Boards: 1,4,5,6,6a,8,9b,11,16,17,18,19,20,21,22,23,32,40,41,42,43,44,45,46,47,49,57,69,70,BFP A,BFP L,BFP P,BFP Q,BFP R.

Name: Panzer Waffe: Eastern Front 1944
Description:
Panzer Waffe: Eastern Front 1944 is an card game that recreates a tank battle in 1944. You can enjoy the construction of the tank platoon by the combination of the cards to a deck.

The deck consists of a combination of tank cards such as firepower, defense force, heavy tank and long range, and tactics cards such as precision shooting, ambush, and infantry assault. Because there is a sudden event during the game, it may not win only in a powerful tank. Pull out the platoon's potential and take advantage of tactics to gain victory.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Cardslingers
Description:
Cardslingers is a trick taking game of bluffing and deduction for 2-4 players. Each round players secretly choose which Wild West character to play and then reveal them simultaneously. The winner of the round will collect a poker chip. Once all 13 chips have been collected, the player with the highest value in chips wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sneak Peek
Description:
The sharp eyed memory and reaction game!

Only a quick mind, eagle eyes and fast fingers can help you win the Sneak Peek game!

Flip the cards and find 3 cards that match by colour, symbol or both. Find a match to keep the cards.

The winner is the player who has the most cards.

Two fun and fast ways to play!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Pooper Heroes Card Game
Description:
The Pooper Heroes card game is the only game where you can play with a pile of cards that turn into poop in your hand. This can happen to any card if you draw them at the wrong time or if the other players use their Pooper Powers against you. Don’t turn your head away from those smelly cards because you can only win this game if you have the fewest cards in your poop pile at the end.

—description from the designer

Name: Basilisk's Lair (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
Description:
The agents are sent to a village in 1799 to find and defuse Basilisk, a monster that got there through a space-time rift from an alternative dimension.

Basilisk's Lair is a Czech fan extension for T.I.M.E Stories. To play it is necessary to own a basic game. It is issued in the form of “print and play”, so you have to print and cut it first.

The script is original, not an adaptation of a book, film, or comic. This is an amateur act, which is reflected primarily in the graphic aspect of the game, but it is comparable with similar acts published here on the site.

The scenario is rather relaxed, you will not have to solve challenging and lengthy puzzles, which does not mean that it is a linear adventure without thinking. At almost any point in time, you will have to make decisions, some of which can be fatal and have a major impact on your group's fate. In addition, there is not only one path leading to the goal, and not all paths lead to the goal.

The scenario will guide you through the preparation and subsequent participation in an expedition to find and kill Basilisk. It contains some non-standard elements (“minilocations”, special status tokens directly printed on the cards) that enrich the basic game principle.

—description from the designer

Name: Iron Cross: 6mm Miniature Wargame System in WWII – Core Rules
Description:
The game Iron Cross was born out of the desire of a group of “wargamers” from the 70s / 80s to simulate their historical battles from WWII, made in the past with maps and tokens, using this time miniatures and 3D scenarios suitable to represent small and medium scale tactical actions. 
We started in 2004, with the launch of our 1st — edition and in the following two years, with the publication of several modules for the system.

The system stopped in 2007, due to some problems with the miniatures and the need to rewrite the rules, since they were already well changed, due to the publication of several articles and modules by us. We left the game in the public hands for a long time, and in this year 2020, we are back in action.

These Rules cover:

     USA, Soviet Union, Germany and Brazil Armies in WW2
     Infantry and Tanks
     4 game scenarios
     Markers for 3d printing
     Player Aids

Name: Munchkin Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Death and Destruction
Description:
The cannibals of the Flesh-Eater Courts use their Pestilential Breath and Septic Talons to impress each other at their grotesque banquets. The battle-crazed Ironjaws swing their Waaagh! Staffs from the back of their Maw-Krusha beasts. Mortal enemies for millennia, these two new Armies have found one patch of common ground: they really don't like you. So do what you do best in Munchkin – kill them ALL. And take their stuff.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vegas Slot Machine 1973: Cumber
Description:
Cumber expansion (3 cards)
Variation A: Lock the 3 Cumber cards in the deck. 3 times Cumber on a payline is 200 points.

Variation B: Lock the 3 Cumber cards in the deck. A player may play a "Cumber" from his hand during his turn to take one of the following actions:
A. Move one symbol card in the slot machine (observe rules of laying).
B. To be the only player who may look in all stacks of the Slot Machine.
C. Place the last card on the bottom of the draw pile. This is allowed in every player's turn. Do not use if a player makes a price.
D. Exchange for 3 cards from the draw pile. At the end of the turn you are still no longer allowed to have three cards in your hand, the other cards are placed at the bottom of the drawpile.
E. Undoing the effect of another player's Cumber card.
F. Special effect: Check the website http://vsm1973.com/effect-of-the-month.html for this special effect. This special effect depends on the month in which you play.

NB. Multiple Cumber cards may be played in one turn by one or more players. The player completes his hand up to three cards after playing a Cumber. If a Cumber from the draw pile enters the slot machine, the Cumber is for the player whose turn it is. The Cumber card counts as a hand card. No more than 3 hand cards per player. 3 times Cumber on a payline is 200 points.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fortress of the Warlord
Description:
There are whispers in the night of a dark force gathering deep within the rainforest. Growing numbers of raiding orcs, trolls, and goblinkind go unchecked. It is up to you and your four adventures to take matters into your own hands. Will you prevail and bring peace and prosperity back to the land?

Fortress of the Warlord is a classic fantasy solo campaign for Four Against Darkness, featuring:

    Four different types of gameplay
    Eighteen new spells
    Forty-five new magic items
    Ninety-six new monsters and variations of the classic ones
    New Alchemy components with 6 new items to craft
    New Arcane Tanning components with 6 new items to craft
    New class: the swampling
    New mount: the swamp ostrich
    New weapon: the weighted net
    New reactions: Sound the Alarm and Shifting Warp


Requires Four Against Darkness, Four Against the Abyss, 2d6 and a d12.

—description from the publisher

Name: Il gioco delle bandiere
Description:
A game of observation and speed to know and paly with 50 flags of the world.
Each card has a flag on one side and some information on the nation on the other (the name in 6 languages, the map and the continent). On the back there is also a characteristic unrelated to the nation.
In the middle of the table there are 20 flags and a deck of cards. Each turn, a card is turned and players must take the flags that have the characteristic just turned over: each correct card is set aside. The characteristics to be found are of various types: presence of stripes, stars, crosses or symbols, presence of 2, 3 or 4 colors, presence of a certain color and belonging to a continent.
Whoever wins the most cards wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Nomi, cose, città
Description:
A word and speed game with 5 different modes.
Each card has a letter on one side and a category on the other. The basis of the game is very simple: you turn a card from the deck and you have to say a word that starts with the letter and belongs to the categories visible in the middle of the table. Whoever does it first wins a card. The game continues until the end of the deck and whoever wins the most wins.
Thanks to the variants included in the rules, you can try different game modes: for example, you turn 5 categories and you have to say words that belong to them, or each player has his own deck of cards and whoever finishes it first wins, or there are 5 letters in the middle of the table and you have to say a word that contains the largest number.

—description from the designer

Name: Battle of Britain
Description:
Battle card game, recreate the greatest air battle in 1940, Britain's RAF versus Germany's Luftwaffe in World War II
Use your battle and tactic cards to out smart your opponent, win dogfights and monitor your squadrons to win battles and ultimately gain air superiority over the fields of Britain. 
Will the few be victorious?

Players will fight 7 battles per round attempting to win the air superiority card.  Whoever wins the most battles this card is moved to their side of the table.  Sequence of play both players must place one of their battle cards face down.  Both players may also play one tactic card face down if applicable. Once done cards are revealed.

Players then work out their final score using a combination of their battle, tactic and event cards, highest score wins.  If a player wins a battle they can change the current event card and also change theirs or their opponents squadrons cards.  Squadron cards will have positive and negative effects on both players.  Event cards will also affect certain cards.

Players can also recreate dogfights in certain situations using a rock, paper, scissor mechanic.  Players must try and get inside their opponents mind, what did they do last round/dogfight etc.

This a pocket card game ideal for travel or to use before or after your main gaming event.  It can also be used to introduce non gamers and children and teach them about history in a quick and fun way.

—description from the designer
Families: History: World War II (Battle of Britain)

Name: Atlantico
Description:
A game related to the "Atlantico" album by popular Italian singer Marco Mengoni, based on a journey to discover, sense, feel, paint the countries around the Atlantic Ocean, with its beauties.
At each turn, each player can choose whether to reach a destination (Europe, Africa, North America and South America) to collect colored tokens or collect a piece of journal representing people, natural beauties and monuments, by using these tokens.
The aim of the game is to travel and collect journals from each continent, along with some additional objectives, and reach the highest score at the end. The inspirational sentences appearing on the journal cards are taken from Mengoni's songs and enrich the poetic journey of this game.

Description by the designer; edited by Markus from Florence

Name: Rustik Racing: Travel
Description: Players throw the dice in turns. Following precise rules, they move their pegs from station to station on the race track until one player reaches station 12.

Name: Gizmos: Extra Credits Promo
Description:
Players get "extra credit" points for building 3 or more Gizmos of the same type.

When a player builds the third Gizmo of one type they get an "extra credit" token for that type. Each player can only earn one token for each type of Gizmo.

At the end of the game, points are awarded for the number of different "extra credit" tokens each player earned.

Available exclusively through Asmodee's "Asmoplay" January 2020 Ingenuity box.

Name: Hellapagos: FIJ 2020 Wreckage promo cards
Description:
Five new Wreckage cards (only in French) for Galèparagos (French edition of Hellapagos).
Distributed at the Festival international des jeux (FIJ) in Cannes.

Name: Dixit AsmoPlay Ingenuity Promos
Description: A set of 5 Dixit cards included in the AsmoPlay Ingenuity box. The box was released in January 2020

Name: Cybermancy: Virtual Arena
Description:
Cybermancy is a future-themed card battling game, in which combat takes place in the Virtual Arena, a computer-generated battle-ground where digital warriors fight in bloody, hand-to-hand combat. Players take on the role of Cybermancers, masters of digital combat, who summon virtual avatars to fight for them in the Virtual Arena.

Each player starts the game with a 30 card Summoning Deck, containing the warriors he will summon to the battlefield. Both players draw 7 cards from their Summoning Deck, then draw 5 cards each from the CPU and RAM Power Deck, which will be used to pay the summoning costs of each warrior. Cybermancy uses a unique dual-track power system, in which players decide each round whether to increase the amount of CPU or RAM available for summoning. This allows unlimited flexibility in designing each deck, as well as important tactical choices every round.

Players can attack their opponent's warriors or the enemy avatar itself. When either Cybermancer's health is reduced to zero, the game is over and the surviving Cybermancer wins!

The base game includes complete decks of cards for both the Human and Undead factions. Unlike collectible card games, Cybermancy provides all of the cards right out of the box, and even allows for players to mix and match warriors from different factions. Future expansions will include warrior tribes such as Robots, Aliens, Celestials, Demons, Dinosaurs and more!

Name: Heroes & Treasure: Arena
Description:
Heroes & Treasure: Arena is a card game for kids and adults that simplifies the traditional one-on-one combat game. It's the perfect introduction to combat card games for people who aren't experts. It is standalone and does not require any experience with the Heroes & Treasure Family RPG.

There are no booster packs to buy, no strategy guides to study, no decks that need building. You can jump right in and enjoy the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Riff-Raff
Description:
The players roll the die to move their 6 discs about the board. The players start with 1 disc on space A of their color. On the roll of an even number another disc is put into play. If a player lands on another disc or a stack of discs, that player captures the stack by putting his or her disc on top of the stack. If a player has captured at least 2 discs, he may return that stack of disks to his home-base (A) to keep them safe. The game ends when there is only one active color of discs left on the board. The winner is the player who captured the most Discs.

—user summary

Name: Adeptus Titanicus: Shadow and Iron
Description:
Discover the secrets of the Shadow Crusade and the Crusade of Iron in this 97-page hardback supplement for Adeptus Titanicus, alongside a host of new rules to use in your games. Harness the psychic might of the Ordo Sinister and devastate your foes with warp-spawned powers. Add new weapons to your god-machines and use them to lay low your enemies. Try out new Stratagems in a host of narrative missions based on the Crusade of Iron. Experience the might of six new Titan Legions and six Knightly Houses, each with their own additional rules. And wage war across a sub-sector with detailed campaign rules that allow you to forge a battlegroup and maintain it across your games. Each victory will add to your roll of honour and increase your power, while each loss will leave you with decisions to make as you use your resources on repairing damaged Titans and keeping your grip on worlds as your foes try to seize them from you.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)

Name: StarDust
Description:
StarDust is a tabletop miniatures game of spaceship combat.

It is an easy-to-play system meant for friendly games using whatever miniatures you have handy.

Eight-sided dice are required and you'll also need some space to play and a tape measure.

This edition includes full rules, ship details, a counter sheet, a quick reference sheet, and four scenarios to get you started.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ultra Quick Hockey
Description:
The scope of Ultra Quick Hockey is much like the other games in the Ultra Quick lineup. With UQ Hockey, we aim to provide you with an extremely quick and accurate method of resolving the final score between two hockey teams. With UQ Hockey you can play out an entire season for a team or a league in rapid fashion. UQ Hockey makes a perfect stand-alone game for season replays. It also functions very well as a complimentary game by resolving the games that don’t particularly interest you in a detailed shot-by-shot game, while you use the detailed game to play out the games that do interest you.

Unlike most quick play games, which only provide a team score, UQ Hockey does offer an optional individual scoring module to allow you to track league leaders in goals and assists. UQ Hockey also features an individual goalie modification for even more realism.

With UQ Hockey, you'll be able to track not only Team wins and losses, but league leaders for Goals scored, assists and GAA.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Hulk Hero Pack
Description:
Saturated by deadly gamma rays while saving his best friend from the detonation of an experimental bomb, the genius Dr. Bruce Banner has transformed into the towering, muscle-bound Hulk. Though Hulk's unbridled rage can make him unpredictable, he is one of the world's strongest heroes. Whether he's angry or not, you'll definitely want the Incredible Hulk on your side with the Hulk Hero Pack for Marvel Champions: The Card Game!

If you've ever wanted to tap into your anger and leap into the fight with the Incredible Hulk, this is where you start. Like every Hero Pack, the Hulk Hero Pack comes with a 40-card pre-built deck, giving you the chance to start playing and smashing the villain right out of the box.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: StarDust: Ground
Description:
StarDust: Ground is a tabletop miniatures wargame designed for 15mm models but suitable for 6mm.

Use any miniatures you already own and some d8 dice.

Enjoy gaming for gaming's sake!

—description from the publisher

Name: Rubber and Lead: Furious Fast Racing
Description:
Rubber and Lead is a miniatures car racing game.

Vehicles are armed with a mix of weapons, but at the end of the day, it's all about who gets across the finish line first!

You will need cars, some dice and a track to race on in addition to these rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Planes and Parachutes: The Caterpillar Club – Gaming Rules for WWII Dogfight
Description:
THE CATERPILLAR CLUB

The average cockpit temperature in a WWII plane shot down reportedly increased from a comfortable 20 degrees to 3,000 degrees centigrade in a matter of a few seconds; escape was virtually impossible.

These set of rules are designed to re-enact the glorious one on one air combat (Dog fighting) during the WWII period between the Spitfire and the ME109.

GAME REQUIREMENTS


     Two, six sided dices (D6)
     Two paper clips (for altitude and speed bar)
     Plane Stats Card (Blanks provided for photocopying)
     Plane Manoeuvre cards. (To be cut out)
     Two or more 1/300-scale planes.


AND A PINCH OF IMAGINATION!

—description from the publisher

Name: Imperial Japanese Army: Manchuria & SE Asia 1940-1945
Description:
The Complete Army Handbook on Imperial Japanese Forces is the database to allow you to field a Japanese force in your Flames of War (The WW2 tabletop miniatures game) games.

Armed with this book you can conquer the plains of Manchuria, invade Tibet, attack the British in Hong Kong, Shanghai, Malaysia, Singapore and Burma.

Dominate SE Asia with your forces and take the pacific War to new, unexplored, heights!

—description from the publisher

Name: 4 Space Potatoes
Description:
A cooperative game where players must explore Mars to find the missing pieces of a martian greenhouse and fix it before all food supplies (potatoes) finish.

The board is a random matrix of hidden cards that the players have to explore moving individually.

Some places hide resources that should be exchanged and combined to create the parts of of greenhouse, but some bad events could happen, like a marsquake that moves the cards, or a meteorites shower that damages some locations.

The players have a limited number of rounds (30) before something unexpected happens, ending the game.

This game was designed at a Global Game Jam.

—description from the designer

Name: Fire Fight! Vietnam 1965-1975 Skirmish Rules
Description:
FIRE FIGHT! Vietnam Skirmish Rules 1965-1975 can be used for any scale from 15mm right up to 1:35th!

Ideal for Platoon up to Company sized encounters (Battalion if you have the room!) from 1960 right through to the end of the war in 1975; but can be used beyond -such as the war with China and the invasion of Cambodia --or even further afield to the Middle East, '67 and '73 wars?

This massive book (227 pages!) has a background section, comprehensive rules section covering everything from firing, wepaons, concealement, cover, tactics, greandes, air launched nasties, flamethrowers, mortars, artillery, forward observers, radios, improvised explosives and booby traps, vehicles from 50cc bikes right up to main battle tanks such as the M48a1 and the T54/55!! 
Also included are optional/advanced rules for things such as animals, village dogs, weather and infiltration amongst other things!

And if this wasn't enough includes a comprehensive TO&E section covering the US Army/USMC, the ARVN, the PLAF (VC main Force and VC Local Force) and the PAVN (NVA)...
 and did I mention helicopters? yes they are covered! 
From the UH-1B, UH-1D and of course the COBRA GUNSHIP!!!

—description from the publisher

Name: Deadly Desserts
Description:
Deadly Desserts is a trick-taking card game. If you've never played a trick-taking game before, Deadly Desserts is the perfect game to start with! The game is played in a series of tricks, in which players play one card each. The winner of each trick takes the cards, most of which deal damage. Thus, your objective is to avoid winning tricks! It's a very fun gameplay style because you win by not winning.

If you're familiar with trick-taking games, Deadly Desserts builds off of classics (e.g. Hearts, Euchre, Bridge) and adds exciting gameplay features, such as Gourmayhem Cards to double cards' values or being able to play 2-10 players rather than 3-4.

—description from the designer

Name: PACIFIC! War in the Pacific 1937-1945: Japanese and US Marine Corps Forces
Description:
Flames of War compliant supplement detailing the Japanese and USMC Forces for the Pacific Theatre  of WW2, 1937 to 1945. Includes special rules on bunkers, detailed order of battle for IJN forces from the invasion of China in '37 to defence of the Home Islands in '45.

Including engineering rules, obstacles and comprehensive rules on bunkers, obstacles, kamikaze attacks, banzai charges and desperate defenders rules.

Detailed TO&E for the USMC from D-Series, E-Series and finally F-Series organisation 
-rules for amphibious assaults, engineers, ship-to-shore bombardments and a whole host more!

Fully illustrated with pictures, photographs and a comprehensive rules and order of battle section make this an invaluable addition to your FoW collection.

—description from the publisher

Name: Armed Forces of Nuevo Colorado: Volume One – Esercito di Stado and Marines, Pere to Perez
Description:
With this book you can re-create a Nuevo Colorado armed force, from the 32nd Air cavalry with their UH-1D and Cobra helicopters, right through to the 28th Armoured Regiment with their assortment of Russian and American armour, including T-62 tanks, M-24's, M-48's and T-55's! Field artillery to support your conscript troops, battle across the jungle, the scorching desert wastes and the urban environment as you hunt down and engage the Contras and bring them to justice at the mercy of your rifles! bring in air support in the form of Phantom II flying out of Bocca Gracia and blast the rebel's!

Also included is the complete TO&E for the Marine Infantry Regiments, the regular Marines (pre-cursors to so many coup's) and the Amphibious Assault Marines 
-the riverine forces with their fleet of landing craft and 'swift' patrol boats; 
details of all vehicles and types abound alongside a comprehensive historical background to this troubled Central American country. 
deploy the UNIT (paramilitary death squads) the Esercito, the Policia nacional and the Local Defence Forceand strike terror in the Contras hearts! 
Call for reinforcements from the Mechanised Regiments aboard their MpT-s3 half tracks (license built M5/M3 half tracks in NC) or the 5th cavalry with their M-113's and organic tank companies!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ne Plus Ultra +: Rules for playing Miniature Battles Set in the High Baroque Period
Description:
Ne Plus Ultra + fast play rules are an evolution of the Ne Plus Ultra rules from NDC Wargames

Initially designed for 15mm.
Families: History: War of the Spanish Succession
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: To Catch a Spy
Description:
As a secret agent, you've been assigned to catch an elusive spy before they get away. Search for clues and find evidence while you track the spy, but watch out for dangerous explosives!

To Catch a Spy is a 1-2 player game of espionage. To set up, place nine location cards in a 3x3 grid, then place discovery cards under each location. Place three file cards near the locations, then place case cards under each file. Place decks for arrow cards and additional discovery cards nearby, along with two agent tool cards. The spy and agent cards start in different locations.

In the solo game, you are the agent and go first, moving to an adjacent location and revealing a discovery card, which could be an item, clue, or bomb; item and clue cards go in hand, while bombs force you to discard. You can use a location's special ability and clues to reveal case cards under files. You might be able to place a tracking bug on the spy.

For the spy's turn, the arrow cards move the spy to an adjacent location, where a new discovery card is placed at random. If the spy moves to your location, discard a card. If you can't discard a card or discover you've discarded an item matching a case card, you lose immediately.

When the discovery deck is empty, the spy attempts to escape. You must have placed a tracking bug on the spy, have the three item cards in hand matching the case cards, and make it to the spy's current location before the spy escapes.

In the two-player game, one player is the spy while the other is the agent. At the start of a round, each player chooses and reveals an arrow card, then the agent takes their turn, followed by the spy. Gameplay takes place as described above, with the spy needing to place all cards in the discovery deck before trying to escape, while the agent needs to collect the three items matching the case, bug the spy, then reach the spy's location.

Awards:

From the 2020 54-Card Game Design Contest.
-Best Solo Game: 1st place!
-Best Overall Game: 2nd place!
-Best 2 Player Game: 2nd place!
-Best Graphic Design: 3rd place!

Name: Il collegio
Description:
Inspired by the Rai TV Show, the game offers a challenge set in a sixties-style college to achieve the middle school diploma of the time.
Players must answer questions in Italian, History, Geography,
Mathematics and Sciences, but also of Latin, Technical applications and Home economics.
To win you have to enter the classrooms to take the exams and avoid the overseers who bring the students in punishment to the principal's office.

—description from the designer

Name: Meteoropatici
Description:
A weather board game that uses a voice assistant.
Meteoropaths are demanding travelers whose mood changes according to the weather: their goal is to live the ideal holiday by traveling in 7 different locations with the climatic conditions they prefer.
The meteoropaths available for each player are: the tan fanatic (look for places with a temperature of 25-35 degrees Celsius), the ecological backpacker (15-25), the decadent poet (10-20), the yeti (0-10).
Meteoropaths move on the board asking the voice assistant for information on the local weather: if the temperature is ideal for them, they earn a day off. Players are helped by souvenirs and baggage cards that they can conquer during the game.
The meteoropathic who first completes his 7-day vacation wins, also collecting 3 selfies in 3 different continents.

—description from the designer

Name: Arena: The Contest – Madness Box
Description: The Madness Box accommodates all the ton of Kickstarter-Exclusive stuff unlocked as Stretch Goals and Community Goals during the Tanares Adventures Campaign.

Name: Arena: The Contest – Lizz the Medusa
Description:
Hero-addon made available during the Tanares Adventures Kickstarter campaign.

1x Lizz Hero Miniature
1x Heropad
4x Attack Cards
1x Token
